Certainly! Here are some suggestions for finding a local art class:

1. Local community centers: Check with your local community center to see if they offer any art classes. These classes are often affordable and cater to all skill levels.

2. Art schools: Check with your local art schools to see if they offer any classes that are open to the public. These classes might be more expensive, but they may offer more advanced techniques and instruction.

3. Local art museums or galleries: Check with your local art museum or gallery to see if they offer any classes or workshops. These classes may be taught by local artists and provide a unique learning experience.

4. Event listings: Check local event listings or publications for information about upcoming art classes or workshops.

5. Online resources: There are many websites that offer directories of art classes and workshops by location, such as Art Classes Near Me, Coursehorse, or Meetup.

Encourage your friend to explore their options and to choose a class that aligns with their interests and skill level. Good luck!
